title: Controversy Erupts:  Bajrang Punia and Vinesh Phogat Get Direct Entry to Asian Games, Sparking Outrage
content:
The Wrestling Federation of India's ad-hoc committee has granted direct entry to Olympic medalist Bajrang Punia and World Championship medalist Vinesh Phogat for the Asian Games, sparking outrage from other athletes and coaches.

This decision has been met with criticism, with many, including coaches and fellow wrestlers like Antim Panghal, questioning the fairness of the exemption.  The protesting wrestlers had requested trials in August to allow them time to prepare, but this request was denied. 

This controversy further highlights the deep divisions within Indian wrestling, with concerns about transparency and fairness in the selection process.
author: Scroll Staff
